title: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When attempting to revert a file in the java editor, it takes much longer compared to simply closing and reopening the file.
EB: This seems odd, since reverting the file contents should not take more time than closing and reopening the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open a Java file in the editor.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. Attempt to revert the changes using the 'Revert' option.
4. Observe the time it takes to complete the revert operation.
5. Close the file and reopen it.
6. Compare the time taken to close and reopen the file with the time taken to revert the changes.
